page.title: 18TOURISM
page.content: Islay is about 40 Kilometres long and 32 Kilometres wide:approx.380 square kilometres or 150,000 acres. The climate is mild because of the effect of the {North Atlantic Drift}of the {Gulf Stream.} Although there is a predominance of holiday homes(second homes)in the block,the villages of Portnahaven and Port Wemyss are not the busiest of tourist centres.There is a steady flow of tourists in the summer months but with the exception of those with residences very few are based in the block.This is due mainly to the lack of hotels and other suitable accomodation.This area provides very few facilities for tourists.There are no caravan/camping sites and very little in the way of recreational facilities.
